alert.note: Alert for Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 10:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MECKLENBURG... SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE EDWARD...NORTHWESTERN LUNENBURG AND SOUTHWESTERN NOTTOWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1002 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wylliesburg, or 7 miles northwest of Chase City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Mecklenburg, southeastern Prince Edward, northwestern Lunenburg and southwestern Nottoway Counties, including the following locations... Prince Edward Station, Spanish Grove, Briery, Loves Mill, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Finneywood, Scholfield, and The Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
